title: Marsupials: Naturally the numbat
creator_credit: David Bairstow, John Shaw and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
brief_description: You mean a wombat don’t you? is the usual reaction but a numbat is quite different - smaller than a cat, with a long pointed nose and a striped back. Numbats live inside hollow logs in densely wooded areas, and eat termites. Includes feeding scenes and close-ups of young numbats.
creator_credit_for_label: David Bairstow, John Shaw and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
